MAPS buildings will be closed for the remainder of the school year.
MAPS has been planning for the potential of offering on-line learning for some time and will begin a program starting April 15th.

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; letter-spacing: normal; line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt; text-align: left;

div.p:
Notice Regarding MAPS School Board Meeting of April 20, 2020 at 9:00 am
Due to Executive Order 2020-48, the April 20th Marquette Area Public School Board meeting will be held virtually at 9:00 am with Board Members and Staff attending remotely through Zoom video conferencing.

a.title: BOARD MEETING - TO BE HELD ELECTRONICALLY

hr.br:
April 7, 2020
Dear MAPS Students, Parents and Guardians,
These are unprecedented and unnerving times. Our first thoughts and priorities are for the safety and well being of all students and families. We hope you're making the best decisions to keep yourselves insulated from the ill effects of this terrible virus. I think I speak for our entire faculty and staff when I say how much we miss our students, daily class activities, traditional ceremonies, and normalcy of everyday school. Unfortunately, it will be awhile before we are all back together.
Thursday, Governor Whitmer issued an executive order cancelling school for the remainder of the year. In this order she also mandated that schools provide on-line learning. MAPS has been planning for the potential of offering on-line learning for some time and will begin a program starting April 15th.
Click here to read more

br.a: For Updates Regarding MAPS's COVID-19 Response and More Information on Coronavirus Prevention, click here

p.a: Online Resources are available, click here to view

div.p:
MAPS has been pleased to provide meals to children 18 and under during these uncertain times. We will continue to have meal drop offs on Tuesdays. Please note we are changing our delivery times.
Meal Delivery Times and Locations:
MSHS 11:00-12:00 in front of the canopy entrance please pull up
Graveraet 10:30-11:20, Employee Parking Lot
Cherry Creek 11:40-12:00, Parking Lot in front of School
Superior Hills 10:40-11:00, Parking Lot in front of School
Whetstone 11:15-11:35, Parking Lot across from Office
Meal Delivery Days:
April 14th
April 21st
April 28th
May 5th
May 12th
May 19th
May 26th
June 2nd
June 9th
Please email if you have any questions at ccollins@mapsnet.org.

div.div: MCHD The Marquette County Health Department - Child and Adolescent Health Center for Marquette Area Public Schools will continue to provide mental health services for current clients and is now accepting new clients. Appointments will be offered via telehealth or phone. There will be no face-to-face appointments at this time. Please contact JoAnne Garrow at (906) 225-5355 if you have any questions or to schedule an appointment.

Tech. Help The MAPS Technology Department is open by appointment for damaged district devices (such as Chromebooks) to be dropped off and repaired. Please email repairs@mapsnet.org to make an appointment. Hours are weekdays 7:30am to 1pm.
Click here for tips on disinfecting your Chromebook
